intro: Heptapleurum catanduanense, commonly known as the Catanduanes holly, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. It has a compact shrub form with glossy foliage, making it a popular ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
